sentences.english: He is one of those people who always seem intent on stirring up trouble among his workmates.
sentences.chinese: 他是個有意要在工友之間挑起糾紛的那種人。

sentences.english: Our workmate has been in danger. We're all concerned about his health.
sentences.chinese: 我們的工友有危險，我們都關心他的健康。

sentences.english: Workers work an intimate death an accident, is pain in my heart forever.
sentences.chinese: 一個親密工友的工亡事故，是我心中永遠的疼痛。

sentences.english: I'd like to propose a toast to our new workmate.
sentences.chinese: 我想要大家爲我們的新工友敬一杯酒。

sentences.english: Strike-breakers are often despised by their workmates.
sentences.chinese: 破壞罷工的人往往被工友們看不起。

sentences.english: He represented his fellow-workers at the union meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他代表工友們列席工會會議。

sentences.english: If it's a business idea, talk to co-workers and colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 如果這是一個商業想法，那麼和工友們同事們交談。

sentences.english: Everyone works, from the President down to the boy who sweeps the floor.
sentences.chinese: 上自總統下至掃地的工友，人人都要做事。

sentences.english: His co-workers were all from a lower background.
sentences.chinese: 他的工友們也大都來自社會底層。

sentences.english: Do you believe that hundreds of college graduates compete for a janitor position?
sentences.chinese: 你相信幾百個大專畢業生在竟爭一個工友的職位嗎？

sentences.english: Silver Card Course is suitable for workers involved in construction trade(s) of high risk.
sentences.chinese: 銀卡課程適合從事建造業高危工作的工友修讀。

definition: migrant worker/temporary worker enlisted on a public project
working woman/variant of 女紅|女红[nu:3 gong1]
educated youth (sent to work in farms during the Cultural Revolution)
fellow townsman/fellow villager/sb from the same hometown
(of an elderly couple) husband or wife
to work a temporary or casual job/(of students) to have a job outside of class time, or during vacation
